alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 11:39PM CST until February 25 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EST/345 AM CST/ EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Hamilton and Marion. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EST /345 AM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1239 AM EST /1139 PM CST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chattanooga, Jasper, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, South Pittsburg, Walden, Lakesite, Whitwell, Kimball, Ridgeside, Fairmount, Harrison, Red Bank, Collegedale, Powells Crossroads, Orme, Hicks Gap State Park, Lone Oak, Lookout Mountain and Martin Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
